intro: Straussia leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-fruited lily, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melanthiaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
